ITM209.name: Business Analytics and Information Systems
ITM209.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ITM209.description: Use of business processes, information technologies, and analytics in creating value and enabling improvements in global business performance.
ITM209.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Business - Admitted major and open to undergraduate students in the Information Technology Minor.

ITM311.name: Systems Analysis and Design
ITM311.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ITM311.description: Structured analysis and design of information systems. Understanding of the system development process, and organizational issues associated with the design and implementation of information systems.
ITM311.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Information Technology Minor.

ITM412.name: Digital Marketing
ITM412.description: Theoretical foundation of digital marketing. Recent tactics, applications, and trends in the online marketplace. Basics of online marketing communications, search engine marketing, social media marketing, and web analytics.
ITM412.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

ITM444.name: Information Technology Project Management
ITM444.description: Practical training and experiences in design, testing, and launch of new information technologies and systems.
ITM444.restrictions: Open to students in the Information Technology Minor.

ITM481.name: Introduction to Business Analytics
ITM481.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ITM481.description: Exploration and predictive analysis of business problems. Analysis concepts and skills in business contexts.Strategic and operational impacts of a firm’s analytics efforts. Basic concepts of big data and specific methods of conceptualizing and analyzing business problems.
ITM481.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Information Technology Minor or approval of department.

ITM490.name: Independent Study in Information Technology
ITM490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ITM490.description: Directed study in information technology under faculty supervision.
ITM490.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

ITM491.name: Special Topics in Information Technology
ITM491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ITM491.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

ITM818.name: Data Management and Visualization in Analytics
ITM818.description: Role of analytics in shaping competitive strategy and improving the design and implementation of business processes. Emphasis on enterprise data management and visualization skill development. Analysis of enterprise data identifying findings and making recommendations. Real-world cases of successes and failures with analytics-based business strategies.
ITM818.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major or approval of department.

ITM821.name: Enterprise Database Systems
ITM821.description: Management of information in business organizations. Conceptual modeling of transaction process systems, workflow systems and enterprise-wide networks of value-added activities. Integration of decision support and policy level systems with economic event processing systems. Evolution of accounting systems.
ITM821.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ITM822.name: Information Systems Project Management
ITM822.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ITM822.description: Management of information system projects. Modeling of business processes. Management of project scope, time and costs. Planning and control of projects. Program and portfolio management. Consulting issues for effective project management.
ITM822.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ITM823.name: Advanced Enterprise Database Systems
ITM823.description: Architecture of enterprise information. Semantic and syntactic modeling of enterprise economic phenomena, relational database technology and database design for business systems, business process analysis patterns and implementation compromises.
ITM823.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ITM824.name: Governance and Control of Enterprise Systems
ITM824.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ITM824.description: Governance and control of information technologies. Identification and valuation of key information and communication technologies, frameworks for assessing information system risk, information system auditing, and international standards for information technology governance and control.
ITM824.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or approval of department.

ITM825.name: Object-Oriented Business Information Systems
ITM825.description: Analysis and design of object-oriented business systems. Unified modeling language descriptions of business phenomena and rules, object-oriented programming, use-case analysis and specifications, and XML tag sets for transactions and reporting.
ITM825.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ITM826.name: Enterprise Information Systems
ITM826.description: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. ERP implementation issues and success factors. Use of enterprise systems, and exploring future directions in ERP systems.
ITM826.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or approval of department.

ITM881.name: Network Analytics
ITM881.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ITM881.description: Application of network analysis in business contexts. Basic methods and terminology associated with network analysis and text analytics leading to broad-based applications. Applications of these techniques span a broad range of business contexts including human resource management, customer relationship management systems, supplier networks, and online networks.
ITM881.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Business Analytics Major or approval of department.

ITM882.name: Analytics Practicum
ITM882.description: Supervised analytics practicum. The design, analysis, execution, and presentation of an analytics project.

ITM883.name: Business Analytics Problem Solving
ITM883.description: Statistical techniques, use of statistical software platform, exposure to statistical programming languages.
ITM883.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major or approval of department.

ITM885.name: Machine Learning and Optimization in Analytics
ITM885.description: Applying different machine learning and optimization techniques to solve organizational problems.
ITM885.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major or approval of department.

ITM886.name: Communication Strategies for Analytics
ITM886.description: Professional communication skills, from basic business writing techniques to cutting-edge digital and social-media strategies.
ITM886.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major or approval of department.

ITM888.name: Capstone: Business Analytics
ITM888.description: Practicum in the development and delivery of predictive data analysis for strategic decision making in organizations. Application of the principles and tools of analytics to real-world problems in research and development, marketing, supply chain, accounting, finance and human resources management. Development and presentation of analytical insights and recommendations.

ITM890.name: Independent Study
ITM890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ITM890.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management. Approval of department.

ITM891.name: Special Topics in Information Technology Management
ITM891.description: Selected topics in current and emerging issues related to information technology management.

ITM893.name: Business Analytics Internship
ITM893.description: Professional internship in a public, industrial, or governmental organization where one or more business analytics projects are performed under faculty supervision.
ITM893.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Business Analytics Major or approval of department.

ITM911.name: Doctoral Seminar in Information Systems
ITM911.description: Seminar in management information systems for new doctoral students and researchers new to the field.

ITM912.name: Information Technology Transactional Perspectives
ITM912.description: Multiple perspectives on relationships between organizations and information technology. Information processing, communications and management strategy approaches. Economic perspectives.

ITM913.name: Seminar in Information Systems Design Science
ITM913.description: Research in design science in information systems. Ontological issues in design science research.

ITM914.name: Behavioral Aspects of Information Systems
ITM914.description: Information systems theory from a behavioral and social science perspective.
ITM914.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of college.

ITM915.name: Seminar in Information Systems and Networks
ITM915.description: Research in social networks in information systems.
ITM915.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

ITM917.name: Research Methods in Information Systems
ITM917.description: Research methodologies utilized to study information systems phenomena from social science, computational science, and clinical approaches. Critique information systems literature from various methodological perspectives.
ITM917.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences or approval of college.
